ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: How happy do you feel about your life as a whole?
Notes: 0= Very sad; 5= Neither happy nor sad; 10= Very happy

ElementDescription: How happy do you feel about the things you have? Like the money you have and the things you own?
Notes: 0= Very sad; 5= Neither happy nor sad; 10= Very happy

ElementDescription: How happy do you feel about how healthy you are?
Notes: 0= Very sad; 5= Neither happy nor sad; 10= Very happy

ElementDescription: How happy do you feel about the things you make or the things you learn?
Notes: 0= Very sad; 5= Neither happy nor sad; 10= Very happy

ElementDescription: How happy do you feel about getting on with the people you know?
Notes: 0= Very sad; 5= Neither happy nor sad; 10= Very happy

ElementDescription: How happy do you feel about how safe you feel?
Notes: 0= Very sad; 5= Neither happy nor sad; 10= Very happy

ElementDescription: How happy do you feel about doing things outside your home?
Notes: 0= Very sad; 5= Neither happy nor sad; 10= Very happy

ElementDescription: How happy do you feel about how things will be later on in life?
Notes: 0= Very sad; 5= Neither happy nor sad; 10= Very happy

ElementDescription: What faces-scale corresponds to the respondent's maximum level of discriminative competence in pre-test Step 4 - Phase 3?
Notes: 1= 2 face diagram; 2= 3 face diagram; 3= 5 face diagram

ElementDescription: Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
Do you feel happy with your life as a whole?
Notes: 1= Not true; 5= Very true

ElementDescription: Do you feel happy about the things you have? Like the money you have or the things you own.
Notes: 1= Not true; 5= Very true

ElementDescription: Do you feel happy about how healthy you are?
Notes: 1= Not true; 5= Very true

ElementDescription: Do you feel happy about what you have achieved so far?
Notes: 1= Not true; 5= Very true

ElementDescription: Do you feel happy overall about the relationships with people you have in your life? For example, friends, family, partners, etc.
Notes: 1= Not true; 5= Very true

ElementDescription: Do you feel safe in your life?
Notes: 1= Not true; 5= Very true

ElementDescription: Do you feel happy about doing things outside your home around other people? For example, group activities, grocery shopping, or community events.
Notes: 1= Not true; 5= Very true

Notes: 1= Not true; 5= Very true

ElementDescription: On the following scale, from 1 (Completely unhappy) to 10 (Completely happy), please rate how happy you are with your life in general
Notes: 1 = Completely unhappy; 10 = Completely happy
